message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CE 

The paper introduces a deep learning framework for inferring the dynamics of a physical system, given by an ordinary differential equation (ODE), from observed state trajectories. The framework incorporates appropriate inductive bias by designing the associated computation graph in a physics-informed manner, enforcing Hamiltonian dynamics with control to learn the underlying dynamics in a transparent way. This work involves machine learning (cs.LG), control systems (cs.SY), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural networks (cs.NE), and computational engineering (cs.CE).
